message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
String fieldToUpdate = "";
counter = fieldValues.get("COUNTER");
Iterator<String> it = Arrays.asList(FieldsToUpdate).iterator();
for(int i=0; i<counter; i++) {
  if(!it.hasNext())  // if you are at the end of the list reset iterator
    it = Arrays.asList(FieldsToUpdate).iterator();
  fieldToUpdate = it.next();
}
return fieldToUpdate;
<<<explanation>>>: The Iterator.next() method is used to get the next element in the iteration. In your case, you are using it to cycle through the fields to update ("AA", "BB", "CC"). When the iterator reaches the end of the list, it is reset to the beginning of the list. This allows you to cycle through the fields in a loop ("AA", "BB", "CC", "AA", "BB", "CC", etc.). The field to update is determined by the counter, which is incremented each time an update call is made.
